Are you fed up not being able to watch BBC iPlayer from the USA? As fellow expats, we understand the frustration of being unable to access your favorite BBC shows while residing in the United States.

The key to unlocking BBC iPlayer from the USA lies in utilizing a Virtual Private Network (VPN). By harnessing the power of a VPN, you can enjoy BBC iPlayer’s extensive library for free, regardless of your geographical location. We will unveil the top VPN providers that excel in unblocking BBC iPlayer and walk you through the setup process, even if you’ve never used a VPN before.

VPNs encrypt your traffic, preventing your activities from being monitored by hackers, your Internet Service Provider (ISP), your employer, or the government. However, they have another major benefit: they allow you to change your IP address. As streaming platforms often rely on the user’s IP address to verify their location, accessing geo-blocked services abroad is as simple as connecting to a server in the appropriate country. So if you are a Brit traveling to the US and want to keep watching BBC, a VPN is the solution.

It’s important to note that the BBC invests substantial resources into improving its geo-restriction measures, making it challenging for most VPNs to bypass these restrictions. However, after thorough testing, we have identified a few VPNs that consistently deliver reliable access to BBC iPlayer in America. While we’ll delve into the detailed reviews of each VPN later in this article, we’ll provide you with a summary of each one upfront.

Prepare yourself to unlock a world of captivating British entertainment, as we guide you through the process of watching BBC iPlayer in the USA. Stay tuned as we reveal the VPN providers that will grant you unrestricted access to the best of the BBC.

With so many VPN providers claiming to be the best, it can be difficult to decide which one to get. At Comparitech, we use a data-based VPN testing methodology to review market-leading VPNs. This allows us to compare services directly to find the best VPNs for specific use cases, including watching iPlayer abroad.

To find the best VPNs for streaming the BBC in the US, we found services that are fast, reliable, and have the features listed below:

Reliably works with BBC iPlayer and similar streaming platforms. We look for VPNs that have solid British servers that work with iPlayer, All 4, ITV Hub, and other popular services such as internet banking.

Offers consistently high-speed connections. Many VPNs run on outdated protocols and slow networks of cheap servers. We recommend fast VPNs that offer modern protocols, such as WireGuard.

Uses strong encryption and includes several other security features. We only recommend VPNs that have fully-featured apps with plenty of advanced privacy and security features. We also test for IP and DNS leaks and ensure the VPN has a kill switch.

Has apps for all the most popular operating systems. We check the VPN, which has apps for Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android, to ensure you can stream iPlayer on all your devices.

Offers good value for money. We only recommend VPNs for BBC in the USA that are fairly priced and give you plenty of bang for your buck. This includes discounts, free trials, and money-back guarantees. We also look at the number of simultaneous device connections supported when assessing value.

Has reliable customer support. We hope you never have to contact customer support, but if you do, it should be a quick and pleasant experience. We test the customer service experience with each of our recommended VPNs and only recommend the very best. We expect to see live chat options with flexible open hours and give extra points if it’s 24 hours and available in a variety of different languages.

Can I watch the BBC abroad with a free VPN?

Free VPN services can be tempting, but we advise against using one for several reasons. The first is their performance; free VPNs rarely have enough servers to support all their users, which manifests as slow speeds. Streaming is pretty data-intensive, particularly at higher resolutions, and as such, you’ll likely experience choppy playback, subpar video quality, long buffering times and data limits. Further, the BBC regularly updates its geo-blocking measures so there’s a good chance you won’t be able to access BBC iPlayer at all with a free VPN service.

These services might be free to use, but they are businesses and as such, exist to make money. Most use an ad-supported model or offer perks like higher speeds for a monthly fee, but some resort to shadier practices. Some services store tracking cookies on your device to see which sites you visit, and sell the resulting consumer profile to advertisers. This takes control over who sees your data out of your hands, which is the exact opposite of what a VPN is supposed to do.

Unfortunately, it’s difficult to even tell if you are using a safe VPN or not. Researchers recently tested 283 free VPN apps and found that almost 40% contained malware, 84% were vulnerable to IPv6 leaks, and 18% used no encryption whatsoever. Well-known services aren’t necessarily safer; in 2015, Hola was caught selling user bandwidth to help run a botnet.

Using a reputable VPN with a clear, customer-first privacy policy is the best way to stay safe online.

Can I watch BBC News with a VPN?

The BBC provides two news services. Its global program, focused on international affairs, is available to users via bbc.com. However, if you want to access the UK’s version of the 24-hour BBC News channel, you must access bbc.co.uk or BBC iPlayer.

You will find that if you are outside the UK, you will be redirected to https://bbc.com.

However, a VPN connected to a UK server allow you to access https://bbc.co.uk as well as BBC IPlayer. The news channel can be accessed directly via iPlayer, so you can keep up to date on the latest news and events in the UK.

How to sign up for BBC iPlayer

Creating a new BBC account is easy and only takes a few minutes. Here’s how to do it:

Go to the login page and click Register Now

You’ll be asked to enter details, including your date of birth, email address, and postal code.

When you’re done, click Register and verify your email address.

British law requires you to have a TV license to watch anything on the BBC iPlayer. While this service sometimes shows a popup making you aware of this, it doesn’t appear every time you try to watch something, and as such, is easy to forget. The iPlayer doesn’t check whether you have a TV license and relies entirely on an honor system.

Alternatives to BBC iPlayer in the USA

Although BBC iPlayer provides a vast collection of British television shows, other options are available for viewers in the USA who want to enjoy UK programming. Here are some alternatives that allow you to watch British TV from the comfort of your living room.

BritBox: A collaboration between the BBC and ITV, BritBox is a British TV lover’s dream come true. From classic Doctor Who episodes to the latest EastEnders seasons, it’s a one-stop-shop for all things British. Plus, there’s no need to fret about legality; it’s all above board.

ITVX: Want more than just the BBC? ITV Hub offers a wide array of content from ITV’s channels. Whether you’re into dramas like Downton Abbey or reality shows like Love Island, ITV Hub has something for everyone.

Sky Go: Sky Go can be a viable option for those with access to a UK Sky subscription. It offers live and on-demand content from Sky’s channels, including sports, movies, and series like Chernobyl.

All 4: All 4’s content is supported by advertisements, which means you don’t need a TV license. You can watch popular shows like The Great British Bake Off and The Inbetweeners for free. It’s a fantastic opportunity to explore British TV without committing to a subscription.

My5: My5 is the streaming platform from Channel 5 where you can watch content from the main channel, and places like 5STAR, 5USA, and 5SELECT. Some of the biggest titles include Only Fools and Horses, The Inheritance, and Police Interceptors.
